state_summary: Medium's CEO Tony Stubblebine explains how he turned around the company's financial struggles, which involved product changes, investor restructuring, renegotiated loans, and cost-cutting measures.
evidence: Medium was losing $2.6 million per month when CEO Tony Stubblebine joined in 2022
The company had to make tough choices such as layoffs, unloading office space, and renegotiating loans

Medium introduced a way to add human expertise to recommendations with Boost, changed its Partner Program incentives to reward thoughtful writing, and added a Featuring tool that allowed publications to curate and promote other stories of interest
keywords: Medium, profitability, cost-cutting, layoffs, investor restructuring, loans
